com.mapbox.android.gestures

Class MultiFingerGesture<L>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.android.gestures.BaseGesture<L>
      • com.mapbox.android.gestures.MultiFingerGesture<L>
  • Type Parameters:
    L - listener that will be called with gesture events/updates.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiFingerTapGestureDetector, ProgressiveGesture

    @UiThread
public abstract class MultiFingerGesture<L>
extends BaseGesture<L>
    Base class for all multi finger gesture detectors.

      • isSloppyGesture

        protected boolean isSloppyGesture()
        Check if we have a sloppy gesture. Sloppy gestures can happen if the edge of the user's hand is touching the screen, for example.

        Thanks to Almer Thie (code.almeros.com).

        Returns:
        true if we detect sloppy gesture, false otherwise

      • canExecute

        protected boolean canExecute(int invokedGestureType)
        Overrides:
        canExecute in class BaseGesture<L>

      • reset

        protected void reset()

      • getCurrentSpan

        public float getCurrentSpan(int firstPointerIndex,
                            int secondPointerIndex)
        Returns the current distance between the two pointers forming the gesture in progress.

        Pointers are sorted by the time they were placed on the screen until lifted up. This means that index 0 will reflect the oldest added, still active pointer and index (getPointersCount() - 1) will reflect the latest added, still active pointer.

        The order of parameters is irrelevant.

        Parameters:
        firstPointerIndex - one of pointers indexes
        secondPointerIndex - one of pointers indexes
        Returns:
        Distance between pointers in pixels.
        See Also:
        pointerIdList

      • getPreviousSpan

        public float getPreviousSpan(int firstPointerIndex,
                             int secondPointerIndex)
        Returns the previous distance between the two pointers forming the gesture in progress.

        Pointers are sorted by the time they were placed on the screen until lifted up. This means that index 0 will reflect the oldest added, still active pointer and index (getPointersCount() - 1) will reflect the latest added, still active pointer.

        The order of parameters is irrelevant.

        Parameters:
        firstPointerIndex - one of pointers indexes
        secondPointerIndex - one of pointers indexes
        Returns:
        Previous distance between pointers in pixels.
        See Also:
        pointerIdList

        public float getCurrentSpanX(int firstPointerIndex,

        The order of parameters is irrelevant.

        Parameters:

      • getSpanThreshold

        public float getSpanThreshold()
        Get minimum span between any pair of finger that is required to pass motion events to this detector.
        Returns:
        minimum span

      • setSpanThreshold

        public void setSpanThreshold(float spanThreshold)
        Set minimum span in pixels between any pair of finger that is required to pass motion events to this detector.

        We encourage to set those values from dimens to accommodate for various screen sizes.

        Parameters:
        spanThreshold - minimum span

      • setSpanThresholdResource

        public void setSpanThresholdResource(@DimenRes
                                     int spanThresholdDimen)
        Set minimum span in dp between any pair of finger that is required to pass motion events to this detector.
        Parameters:
        spanThresholdDimen - minimum span
